abstract: Viterra, Canada’s largest grain handler, has offered $1.4 billion Canadian dollars ($1.2 billion) in cash and stock to take over an Australian rival.
snippet: Viterra, Canada’s largest grain handler, has offered $1.4 billion Canadian dollars ($1.2 billion) in cash and stock to take over an Australian rival.
lead_paragraph: Viterra, Canada’s largest grain handler, has offered $1.4 billion Canadian dollars ($1.2 billion) in cash and stock to take over Australian rival ABB Grain, whose board has unanimously recommended shareholders approve the deal.

headline.main: Canada’s Viterra Offers $1.2 Billion for Australian Rival
